name: health_check
description:
Basic health check endpoint that verifies system component status.

    Checks:
    - Database connectivity and performance
    - Scheduler status
    - Cache service status
    - Celery worker status

Returns:
    HealthResponse: Overall system health status and component details.

name: health_check_db
description: Basic database connectivity check.

name: basic_health_check
description: Basic health check endpoint.

name: detailed_health_check
description: Detailed health check with service status.

name: check_frontend_health
description:
DEPRECATED: Use /api/v1/health/unified instead.
    Check frontend application health.

Returns:
    Frontend health status including accessibility, rendering, and JS error checks.

name: check_frontend_health
description:
DEPRECATED: Use /api/v1/health/unified instead.
    Check frontend application health.

Returns:
    Frontend health status including accessibility, rendering, and JS error checks.

name: check_database_health_deprecated
description:
DEPRECATED: Use /api/v1/health/unified/component/database instead.
    Check comprehensive database health.

Returns:
    Detailed database health status including PostgreSQL, ChromaDB and performance metrics.

name: check_comprehensive_health
description:
DEPRECATED: Use /api/v1/health/unified instead.
    Check comprehensive system health across all components.

Returns:
    Complete system health status including backend, frontend, and database components.

name: readiness_probe
description: Kubernetes readiness probe.

name: liveness_probe
description: Kubernetes liveness probe.

name: startup_probe
description: Kubernetes startup probe.

name: environment_info
description: Get environment-specific information.

name: unified_health_check
description:
Unified health check using consolidated health monitoring service.

This endpoint uses the new unified health monitoring service that aggregates:
- Logging health
- ChromaDB health
- Database connectivity (PostgreSQL/SQLite)
- Redis connectivity

Returns:
        Dict with overall status and component-level health details.

name: unified_component_health
description:
Get health status for a specific component via unified service.

Supported components:
- logging, log, logs
- chroma, chromadb, vector
- database, db, postgres, postgresql, sqlite
- redis, cache

Args:
        component: Component name to check.

Returns:
        Component-specific health status.

name: health_analytics_summary
description:
Get health analytics summary for the specified time period.

Args:
        hours: Number of hours to analyze (default: 24).

Returns:
        Analytics summary with uptime, incidents, and trends.

name: health_analytics_component
description:
Get analytics for a specific component.

Args:
        component: Component name.
        hours: Number of hours to analyze (default: 24).

Returns:
        Component-specific analytics with availability and trends.

name: health_availability_report
description:
Get availability report with SLA compliance metrics.

Args:
        hours: Number of hours to analyze (default: 24).

Returns:
        Availability report with uptime %, downtime minutes, SLA compliance.

name: health_performance_trends
description:
Get performance trend analysis across all components.

Args:
        hours: Number of hours to analyze (default: 24).

Returns:
        Performance metrics including average, min, max, p95, p99 response times.

name: check_health_alerts
description:
Check current health status and trigger alerts if availability is below threshold.

Args:
        availability_threshold: Minimum acceptable availability percentage (default: 99.9).

Returns:
        Alert status with triggered alerts if any.

name: health_migration_guide
description:
Get migration guide for transitioning from deprecated endpoints to unified health API.

Returns:
        Migration guide with endpoint mappings and deprecation timeline.

name: google_oauth_login
description:
Initiate Google OAuth 2.0 authentication flow.
Redirects user to Google's authorization page.

Returns:
        RedirectResponse: Redirect to Google OAuth consent screen

name: google_oauth_callback
description:
Handle Google OAuth callback and create/update user.

Args:
        code: Authorization code from Google
        db: Database session

Returns:
        dict: User information and access token

name: linkedin_oauth_login
description:
Initiate LinkedIn OAuth 2.0 authentication flow.
Redirects user to LinkedIn's authorization page.

Returns:
        RedirectResponse: Redirect to LinkedIn OAuth consent screen

name: linkedin_oauth_callback
description:
Handle LinkedIn OAuth callback and create/update user.

Args:
        code: Authorization code from LinkedIn
        db: Database session

Returns:
        dict: User information and access token

name: get_current_user_info
description:
Get the currently authenticated user's profile information.

Returns:
        UserResponse: Current user's profile data

name: update_current_user
description:
Update the currently authenticated user's profile.

Args:
        user_update: Fields to update
        current_user: Current authenticated user
        db: Database session

Returns:
        UserResponse: Updated user profile

name: list_users
description:
List all users (admin only in production).
For now, returns all users with pagination.

Args:
        skip: Number of records to skip
        limit: Maximum number of records to return
        current_user: Current authenticated user
        db: Database session

Returns:
        List[UserResponse]: List of users

name: create_user
description:
Create a new user account.

Args:
        user_data: User creation data
        db: Database session

Returns:
        UserResponse: Created user profile

name: get_user_by_id
description:
Get a specific user by ID.

Args:
        user_id: User ID to retrieve
        current_user: Current authenticated user
        db: Database session

Returns:
        UserResponse: User profile

name: delete_user
description:
Delete a user account (admin only in production).

Args:
        user_id: User ID to delete
        current_user: Current authenticated user
        db: Database session

name: get_user_preferences
description:
Get user's job search preferences for personalization.

Returns preferences including:
- Industries of interest
- Preferred locations
- Salary expectations
- Job types (full-time, contract, etc.)
- Experience level
- Skills
- Company size preferences

name: update_user_preferences
description:
Update user's job search preferences.

Updates preferences and invalidates recommendation cache.

name: get_user_behavior
description:
Get user's job interaction behavior history.

Returns:
- Viewed jobs
- Applied jobs
- Saved jobs
- Rejected jobs
- Search queries
- Click patterns

name: track_user_behavior
description:
Track a user behavior action (view, apply, save, reject).

Updates behavior history and invalidates recommendation cache
to improve future recommendations.

name: get_available_jobs
description:
Get all available jobs for matching/recommendation.

Returns jobs that haven't been applied to by the current user.
Includes job details needed for personalization matching.

name: get_social_feed
description:
Get social feed with career updates, achievements, and community posts.

Returns personalized feed including:
- Job application milestones
- Skill achievements
- Career progress updates
- Community posts

parameters.name: limit
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=20 alias='limit' description='Number of feed items' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=100)]

parameters.name: offset
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=0 alias='offset' description='Offset for pagination' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=0)]

parameters.name: feed_type
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='feed_type' description='Filter: general, achievement, milestone, job_update' json_schema_extra={}

name: create_social_post
description:
Create a new social feed post.

Share career achievements, milestones, or general updates.
Posts can be tagged and categorized for better organization.

name: get_career_resources
description:
Get personalized career resource recommendations.

Returns learning resources tailored to user's skills and career goals:
- Online courses (Coursera, Udemy, Pluralsight, etc.)
- Technical articles and tutorials
- YouTube videos and channels
- Books and documentation
- Tools and frameworks
- Professional certifications

Uses intelligent matching based on:
- User's skills and skill gaps
- Experience level and career goals
- Previous feedback and completions
- Resource popularity and ratings

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='resource_type' description='Filter by type: course, article, video, book, tool, certification' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: skill
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='skill' description='Filter by skill' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: difficulty
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='difficulty' description='Filter by difficulty: beginner, intermediate, advanced' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: limit
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=20 alias='limit' description='Number of resources to return' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=100)]

parameters.name: offset
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=0 alias='offset' description='Offset for pagination' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=0)]

name: bookmark_resource
description:
Bookmark a career resource for later.

Creates a bookmark for tracking learning resources.
Allows organizing resources by priority and status.

name: submit_resource_feedback
description:
Submit feedback on a career resource.

Tracks resource helpfulness, completion, and ratings.
Used to improve recommendations and help other users.

Feedback contributes to:
- Personalized recommendation refinement
- Resource quality metrics
- Learning progress tracking

name: get_user_bookmarks
description:
Get user's bookmarked resources.

Returns all bookmarked resources with their details and progress status.
Supports filtering by resource type and bookmark status.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='resource_type' description='Filter by resource type' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: status
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='status' description='Filter by status: to_learn, in_progress, completed, archived' json_schema_extra={}

name: update_bookmark
description:
Update bookmark details and progress.

Allows updating:
- Notes and priority
- Status (to_learn, in_progress, completed, archived)
- Progress percentage

name: get_user_learning_stats
description:
Get user's learning statistics and progress.

Returns comprehensive metrics including:
- Total bookmarks by status
- Completed resources
- Average ratings given
- Total learning hours

name: search_jobs
description:
Advanced job search with comprehensive filtering and caching.

- **query**: Search term for job title, company, description, or tech stack
- **location**: Filter by location (partial match)
- **remote_only**: Only show remote jobs (remote_option = 'remote' or 'yes')
- **job_type**: Filter by job type (full-time, part-time, contract, etc.)
- **min_salary**: Minimum salary filter (uses salary_min field)
- **max_salary**: Maximum salary filter (uses salary_max field)
- **tech_stack**: Filter by technologies (comma-separated or multiple params)
- **skip**: Number of records to skip (default: 0)
- **limit**: Maximum number of records to return (default: 100)
- **use_cache**: Enable result caching (default: True, 15-minute TTL)

parameters.name: remote_only
parameters.default: False

parameters.name: tech_stack
parameters.default: annotation=List[str] required=False default=[] alias='tech_stack' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: use_cache
parameters.default: True

name: get_job_recommendations
description:
Get personalized job recommendations based on user's skills and preferences.

- **limit**: Maximum number of recommendations (default: 10)
- **min_match_score**: Minimum match score percentage (default: 70)

name: get_jobs_analytics
description:
Get analytics for jobs including application statistics.

- **timeframe_days**: Number of days to analyze (default: 30)

name: list_jobs
description:
List all jobs for the current user with pagination support.

- **skip**: Number of records to skip (default: 0)
- **limit**: Maximum number of records to return (default: 100, max: 1000)

Returns jobs ordered by created_at descending (newest first).

name: create_job
description:
Create a new job with validation for required fields.

- **company**: Required company name
- **title**: Required job title
- **tech_stack**: Optional list of technologies (defaults to empty list)
- **responsibilities**: Optional job responsibilities
- **source**: Source of the job (manual, scraped, api) - defaults to "manual"

name: get_job
description:
Get a specific job by ID.

- **job_id**: ID of the job to retrieve

Returns 404 if the job doesn't exist or doesn't belong to the current user.

name: update_job
description:
Update a job with all fields supported.

- Automatically updates the updated_at timestamp
- Sets date_applied when status changes to "applied"
- Validates that the job belongs to the current user

name: delete_job
description:
Delete a job and all associated applications (cascade delete).

- **job_id**: ID of the job to delete

The cascade delete is configured in the Job model relationship,
so all associated Application records will be automatically deleted.

name: get_source_analytics
description: Get analytics for job sources

name: get_source_recommendations
description:
Get personalized job source recommendations for the current user.

Returns recommended job sources based on user's historical success rates
and overall source quality metrics.

name: get_job_source_info
description:
Get detailed source information for a specific job.

- **job_id**: ID of the job to analyze

Returns source quality metrics, reliability indicators, and enriched data.

name: trigger_job_scraping
description:
Manually trigger job scraping from multiple sources.

- **search_params**: Dictionary with:
        - skills: List of skills/keywords to search for
        - locations: List of preferred locations
        - remote: Boolean to include remote jobs (default: user's preference)
        - max_jobs: Maximum number of jobs to scrape (default: 100)

Returns scraped jobs that were added to the user's job list.

name: get_available_sources
description:
Get information about all available job sources.

Returns metadata, quality scores, and availability status for each source.

name: get_source_performance_summary
description:
Get comprehensive performance summary for all job sources.

- **timeframe_days**: Number of days to analyze (default: 30)

Returns performance rankings, quality metrics, and recommendations.

name: update_source_preferences
description:
Update user's job source preferences.

- **preferred_sources**: List of preferred job sources
- **disabled_sources**: List of disabled job sources
- **source_priorities**: Custom source priority weights
- **auto_scraping_enabled**: Enable/disable automatic job scraping
- **max_jobs_per_source**: Maximum jobs to fetch per source
- **min_quality_threshold**: Minimum quality score to accept jobs

name: get_job_enrichment_data
description:
Get enriched data for a specific job including source quality and external data.

- **job_id**: ID of the job to enrich
- **include_external**: Whether to include external API data (slower)

Returns comprehensive job enrichment data including source metrics and external insights.

parameters.name: include_external
parameters.default: False

name: get_available_job_sources
description:
Get all available job sources with their metadata and user preferences.

Returns comprehensive information about each job source including:
- Display name and description
- Quality scores and metrics
- API requirements
- User's current preferences

name: create_job_source_preferences
description:
Create job source preferences for the current user.

- **preferred_sources**: List of preferred job sources
- **disabled_sources**: List of sources to disable
- **source_priorities**: Custom priority weights for sources
- **auto_scraping_enabled**: Enable automatic job scraping
- **max_jobs_per_source**: Maximum jobs to fetch per source
- **min_quality_threshold**: Minimum quality score threshold

name: update_job_source_preferences
description:
Update job source preferences for the current user.

Only provided fields will be updated. Omitted fields remain unchanged.

name: get_job_source_preferences
description:
Get current user's job source preferences.

Returns 404 if no preferences have been set.

name: get_job_source_analytics
description:
Get comprehensive analytics for job sources.

- **timeframe_days**: Number of days to analyze (1-365)
- **include_trends**: Whether to include trend analysis

Returns quality scores, performance metrics, trends, and personalized insights.

parameters.name: timeframe_days
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=30 alias='timeframe_days' description='Number of days to analyze' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=365)]

parameters.name: include_trends
parameters.default: annotation=bool required=False default=True alias='include_trends' description='Include trend analysis' json_schema_extra={}

name: get_source_recommendations
description:
Get personalized job source recommendations.

- **limit**: Maximum number of recommendations to return (1-10)

Returns recommended sources based on user's historical performance and preferences.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=5 alias='limit' description='Maximum number of recommendations' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=10)]

name: get_source_quality_metrics
description:
Get detailed quality metrics for a specific job source.

- **source**: Name of the job source to analyze
- **timeframe_days**: Number of days to analyze (1-365)

Returns comprehensive quality analysis including data completeness, accuracy, and user engagement.

parameters.name: timeframe_days
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=30 alias='timeframe_days' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=365)]

name: update_source_priority
description:
Update priority for a specific job source.

- **source**: Name of the job source
- **priority**: Priority score (0-10, higher is better)

Updates the user's custom source priorities.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.default: annotation=float required=True alias='priority' description='Priority score (0-10)' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=0), Le(le=10)]

name: get_applications_summary
description:
Get summary of applications statistics.

- **timeframe_days**: Number of days to analyze (default: 30)

name: get_applications_stats
description:
Get detailed application statistics.

- **group_by**: Group results by 'status', 'month', or 'week' (default: 'status')
- **timeframe_days**: Number of days to analyze (default: 30)

parameters.name: group_by
parameters.default: status

name: search_applications
description:
Advanced application search with comprehensive filtering, sorting, and caching.

- **query**: Search term for job title, company, or notes (searches across job details)
- **status**: Filter by application status (interested, applied, interview, offer, rejected, accepted, declined)
- **start_date**: Filter applications created on or after this date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- **end_date**: Filter applications created on or before this date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- **sort_by**: Field to sort by (created_at, updated_at, applied_date, status) - default: created_at
- **sort_order**: Sort order (asc, desc) - default: desc
- **skip**: Number of records to skip (default: 0)
- **limit**: Maximum number of records to return (default: 100)
- **use_cache**: Enable result caching (default: True, 5-minute TTL)

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.default: created_at

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.default: desc

parameters.name: use_cache
parameters.default: True

name: list_applications
description:
List all applications for the current user with optional status filtering.

- **skip**: Number of records to skip (default: 0)
- **limit**: Maximum number of records to return (default: 100)
- **status**: Filter by application status (optional)

Returns applications ordered by created_at descending (newest first).

name: create_application
description:
Create a new application for a job.

- **job_id**: ID of the job to apply for (required)
- **status**: Initial status (default: "interested")
- **notes**: Optional notes about the application

name: get_application
description:
Get a specific application by ID.

- **app_id**: ID of the application to retrieve

name: update_application
description:
Update an application's status and other fields.

- **app_id**: ID of the application to update
- **status**: New status (interested, applied, interview, offer, rejected, accepted, declined)
- **response_date**: Date of response from employer
- **interview_date**: Date and time of interview
- **offer_date**: Date of job offer
- **notes**: Updated notes
- **follow_up_date**: Date for follow-up

When status changes to "applied", the associated job's status and date_applied are also updated.

name: delete_application
description:
Delete an application by ID.

- **app_id**: ID of the application to delete

name: list_resumes
description: List all resumes for the current user

name: get_resume_history
description: Get resume upload and parsing history

name: upload_resume
description:
Upload a resume file for parsing

Accepts PDF, DOCX, and DOC files up to 10MB

parameters.name: file
parameters.default: annotation=UploadFile required=True alias='file' json_schema_extra={}

name: get_parsing_status
description: Get the parsing status and results for a resume upload

name: get_profile_suggestions
description: Get profile update suggestions based on parsed resume data

name: apply_profile_suggestions
description: Apply profile update suggestions from parsed resume data

name: parse_job_description
description:
Parse a job description from URL or text to extract structured data

Accepts either job_url or description_text (at least one required)

name: test_job_description_parsing
description: Test endpoint for job description parsing (development use)

name: generate_content
description: Generate personalized content (cover letters, resume tailoring, email templates)

name: get_content
description: Get generated content by ID

name: update_content
description: Update generated content with user modifications

name: get_user_content
description: Get all content generated by a user (only accessible by the user themselves)

name: get_content_versions
description: Get all versions of a content generation

name: rollback_content
description: Rollback content to a specific version

name: get_template_suggestions
description: Get template suggestions for content based on job and user context

name: track_content_modifications
description: Track user modifications to content for learning purposes

name: analyze_content_quality
description: Analyze content quality and provide scoring and suggestions

name: check_content_grammar
description: Check content for spelling and grammar issues

name: export_content
description: Export content in different formats (txt, html, markdown)

name: preview_content_with_quality
description: Generate content preview with quality analysis before saving

name: export_jobs
description:
Export jobs in specified format with optional filtering and pagination.

Supports:
- JSON: Paginated, structured data with metadata
- CSV: Flat file format suitable for spreadsheets
- PDF: Professional formatted report with charts

parameters.name: format
parameters.default: annotation=ExportFormat required=False default=<ExportFormat.JSON: 'json'> alias='format' description='Export format (json, csv, pdf)' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: status
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='status' description='Filter by job status' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: company
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='company' description='Filter by company name' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: location
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='location' description='Filter by location' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: job_type
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='job_type' description='Filter by job type' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: remote_option
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='remote_option' description='Filter by remote option' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.default: annotation=Union[datetime, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='date_from' description='Filter jobs created after this date' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.default: annotation=Union[datetime, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='date_to' description='Filter jobs created before this date' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: page
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=1 alias='page' description='Page number for pagination (JSON only)' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1)]

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=100 alias='page_size' description='Records per page (JSON only)' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=1000)]

name: export_applications
description:
Export applications in specified format with optional filtering and pagination.

Supports:
- JSON: Paginated, structured data with job details
- CSV: Flat file format with interview feedback as JSON string
- PDF: Professional formatted report with status summary

parameters.name: format
parameters.default: annotation=ExportFormat required=False default=<ExportFormat.JSON: 'json'> alias='format' description='Export format (json, csv, pdf)' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: status
parameters.default: annotation=Union[str, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='status' description='Filter by application status' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.default: annotation=Union[datetime, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='date_from' description='Filter applications created after this date' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.default: annotation=Union[datetime, NoneType] required=False default=None alias='date_to' description='Filter applications created before this date' json_schema_extra={}

parameters.name: page
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=1 alias='page' description='Page number for pagination (JSON only)' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1)]

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=100 alias='page_size' description='Records per page (JSON only)' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=1000)]

name: create_full_backup
description:
Create a complete backup archive containing all user data.

The backup includes:
- User profile and settings (JSON)
- All jobs (JSON and CSV)
- All applications (JSON and CSV)
- Export metadata
- README with instructions

Returns a ZIP archive for download.

name: import_jobs
description:
Import jobs from CSV file.

The CSV file should have the following columns:
- company (required): Company name
- title (required): Job title
- location: Job location
- description: Job description
- requirements: Job requirements
- responsibilities: Job responsibilities
- salary_min: Minimum salary
- salary_max: Maximum salary
- job_type: Type of job (full-time, part-time, contract)
- remote_option: Remote work option (remote, hybrid, onsite)
- tech_stack: Comma-separated list of technologies
- application_url: URL to apply
- source: Source of the job (manual, scraped, api, etc.)
- status: Job status (not_applied, applied, interviewing, offer, rejected)
- date_applied: Date applied (ISO format)
- notes: Additional notes
- currency: Salary currency

Returns:
- ImportResult with success/failure counts and detailed error information

parameters.name: file
parameters.default: annotation=UploadFile required=True alias='file' description='CSV file containing job data' json_schema_extra={}

name: import_applications
description:
Import applications from CSV file.

The CSV file should have the following columns:
- job_id (required): ID of the job (must exist in the database)
- status: Application status (interested, applied, interview, offer, rejected, accepted, declined)
- applied_date: Date applied (ISO format)
- response_date: Date of response (ISO format)
- interview_date: Date and time of interview (ISO format)
- offer_date: Date of offer (ISO format)
- follow_up_date: Date for follow-up (ISO format)
- notes: Additional notes
- interview_feedback: Interview feedback as JSON string

Returns:
- ImportResult with success/failure counts and detailed error information

Note: The job_id must reference an existing job that belongs to the current user.

parameters.name: file
parameters.default: annotation=UploadFile required=True alias='file' description='CSV file containing application data' json_schema_extra={}

name: bulk_create_jobs
description:
Create multiple jobs in a single transaction.

- **jobs**: List of job creation data (max 1000 items)

All jobs are created within a single database transaction for atomicity.
If any job fails validation, it will be skipped and reported in the errors list,
but other valid jobs will still be created.

Returns detailed results including:
- Total number of jobs in request
- Number of successfully created jobs
- Number of failed jobs
- IDs of created jobs
- Error details for failed jobs

**Example Request:**
```json
{
    "jobs": [
        {
            "company": "Tech Corp",
            "title": "Senior Developer",
            "location": "San Francisco, CA",
            "tech_stack": ["Python", "FastAPI", "PostgreSQL"]
        },
        {
            "company": "Startup Inc",
            "title": "Full Stack Engineer",
            "remote_option": "yes"
        }
    ]
}
```

name: bulk_create_applications
description:
Create multiple applications in a single transaction.

- **applications**: List of application creation data (max 1000 items)

All applications are created within a single database transaction for atomicity.
Each application must reference a valid job_id that belongs to the current user.
Duplicate applications for the same job will be rejected.

Returns detailed results including:
- Total number of applications in request
- Number of successfully created applications
- Number of failed applications
- IDs of created applications
- Error details for failed applications

**Example Request:**
```json
{
    "applications": [
        {
            "job_id": 123,
            "status": "applied",
            "notes": "Applied via company website"
        },
        {
            "job_id": 124,
            "status": "interested"
        }
    ]
}
```

name: bulk_update_jobs
bulk_update_applications
bulk_delete_jobs
description:
Delete multiple jobs in a single transaction.

- **ids**: List of job IDs to delete (max 1000 items)
- **soft_delete**: If true, mark jobs as deleted instead of removing them (default: false)

All deletions are performed within a single database transaction for atomicity.
Each job must belong to the current user.

**Hard Delete (soft_delete=false):**
- Jobs are permanently removed from the database
- Associated applications are also deleted (cascade delete)

**Soft Delete (soft_delete=true):**
- Jobs are marked with status "deleted" but remain in database
- Applications are not affected
- Useful for maintaining historical data

Returns detailed results including:
- Total number of IDs in request
- Number of successfully deleted jobs
- Number of failed deletions
- IDs of deleted jobs
- Whether soft delete was used
- Error details for failed deletions

**Example Request:**
```json
{
    "ids": [123, 124, 125],
    "soft_delete": false
}
```

name: bulk_delete_applications
description:
Delete multiple applications in a single transaction.

- **ids**: List of application IDs to delete (max 1000 items)
- **soft_delete**: If true, mark applications as deleted instead of removing them (default: false)

All deletions are performed within a single database transaction for atomicity.
Each application must belong to the current user.

**Hard Delete (soft_delete=false):**
- Applications are permanently removed from the database

**Soft Delete (soft_delete=true):**
- Applications are marked with status "deleted" but remain in database
- Useful for maintaining historical data

Returns detailed results including:
- Total number of IDs in request
- Number of successfully deleted applications
- Number of failed deletions
- IDs of deleted applications
- Whether soft delete was used
- Error details for failed deletions

**Example Request:**
```json
{
    "ids": [456, 457, 458],
    "soft_delete": true
}
```

name: get_comprehensive_dashboard

name: get_comprehensive_analytics_summary
description:
Get comprehensive analytics summary with all metrics.

This endpoint provides:
- Application counts by status
- Interview, offer, and acceptance rates
- Daily, weekly, and monthly application trends

Get detailed trend analysis with direction and percentage changes.

This endpoint provides:
- Trend direction (up, down, neutral) for daily, weekly, and monthly periods
- Percentage changes from previous periods

Supports custom time ranges for flexible analysis.

Requirements: 6.3

name: get_detailed_success_rates
description:
Get detailed application success rate analysis.

Provides comprehensive analysis of:
- Application to interview conversion rates
- Interview to offer conversion rates
- Overall success rates and rejection rates
- Weekly performance trends
- Industry and company performance breakdown
- Temporal analysis with trend identification

Returns actionable insights for improving success rates.

Get detailed conversion funnel analysis.

Analyzes the complete job application funnel:
- Applications submitted
- Initial screening pass rate
- Interview scheduling rate
- Offer conversion rate
- Offer acceptance rate

Includes:
- Stage-by-stage conversion rates
- Average time spent in each stage
- Bottleneck identification
- Success factor analysis
- Improvement recommendations

Essential for optimizing the job search process.

parameters.name: days
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=90 alias='days' description='Analysis period in days' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=30), Le(le=365)]

name: get_performance_benchmarks

Get personalized performance benchmarking against market averages.

Compares user performance to market benchmarks:
- Application success rates vs market average
- Interview conversion rates vs peers
- Activity levels vs recommended rates
- Percentile rankings across key metrics
- Performance category classification

Provides:
- Detailed benchmark comparisons
- Percentile rankings
- Performance insights and recommendations
- Market position assessment
- Improvement potential analysis

Helps users understand their competitive position.

parameters.name: days
parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=90 alias='days' description='Analysis period in days' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=30), Le(le=365)]

Uses historical performance data to predict:
- Success probability for future applications
- Estimated time to next job offer
- Recommended application rate for optimal results
- Optimal job types based on past success
- Risk factors that may impact success
- Success factors to leverage

Includes:
- Machine learning-based predictions
- Confidence levels and model accuracy
- Personalized recommendations
- Strategic guidance for job search optimization

Enables data-driven job search strategy.

name: generate_weekly_report
description:
Generate a comprehensive weekly analytics report.

Creates a detailed weekly report including:
- Application activity summary
- Success rate trends
- Performance benchmarks
- Key insights and recommendations
- Goals for the upcoming week

Returns the complete report data in JSON format.

name: generate_monthly_report
description:
Generate a comprehensive monthly analytics report.

Creates a detailed monthly report including:
- Executive summary with key metrics
- Detailed analytics across all areas
- Trend analysis and performance evolution
- Competitive position assessment
- Market insights and opportunities
- Strategic recommendations
- Next month strategy and goals

Returns the complete report data in JSON format.

name: email_weekly_report
description:
Generate and email weekly analytics report.

Generates a weekly report and sends it to the user's email address.
The email includes:
- HTML formatted summary
- Complete analytics data as JSON attachment
- Key insights and recommendations

Processing happens in the background to avoid timeout.

name: email_monthly_report
description:
Generate and email monthly analytics report.

Generates a comprehensive monthly report and sends it to the user's email address.
The email includes:
- HTML formatted executive summary
- Complete analytics data as JSON attachment
- Strategic insights and recommendations
- Next month strategy

Processing happens in the background to avoid timeout.

name: schedule_all_weekly_reports
description:
Schedule weekly reports for all users (Admin only).

Generates and sends weekly reports to all users with email addresses.
This endpoint is typically called by a scheduled job.

Requires admin privileges.

name: schedule_all_monthly_reports
description:
Schedule monthly reports for all users (Admin only).

Generates and sends monthly reports to all users with email addresses.
This endpoint is typically called by a scheduled job.

Requires admin privileges.

Preview weekly report content without generating full report.

Returns a lightweight preview of what would be included in the weekly report:
- Summary metrics
- Key insights preview
- Top recommendations

Useful for users to see what they'll receive before subscribing to reports.

name: preview_monthly_report
description:
Preview monthly report content without generating full report.

Returns a lightweight preview of what would be included in the monthly report:
- Executive summary metrics
- Analysis sections overview
- Strategic insights preview

Useful for users to see what they'll receive before subscribing to reports.

    Performance metrics including query statistics and connection pool info

parameters.default: annotation=int required=False default=1 alias='hours' description='Hours of metrics to retrieve' json_schema_extra={} metadata=[Ge(ge=1), Le(le=168)]

Analyze slow queries and provide optimization suggestions.

Returns:
    Slow query analysis with optimization suggestions

name: vacuum_table

Perform VACUUM operation on a specific table to reclaim space and update statistics.

Args:
    table_name: Name of the table to vacuum
    analyze: Whether to run ANALYZE after VACUUM
    current_user: Current authenticated user
    session: Database session

Returns:
    Vacuum operation result
